learning_outcomes.description: Recognise and explain the importance of business analytics to managerial decision making
Explain the basic concepts used in business analytics and their applications to managerial decision making
Identify and apply the appropriate methods of business analytics for solving a range of business problems
Compare and critically evaluate the various approaches to business analytics, and
Evaluate the value of business analytics for improving managerial and strategic decision making.

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment 1 - Structured Summary and Article Review
assessments.due_date:
Component 1: Structured Summary (10%) - During Tutorial Week 4,

Component 2: Article Review (20%) 24/04/2026 3:00 pm
assessments.task_description:
This assessment consists of two components: a Structured Summary (10%) and an Article Review (20%). Component 1 requires students to write a structured summary of a business analytics related article, while Component 2 involves constructing a critical article review on a selected business analytics topic. Further details regarding assessment requirements, format, and style are provided in the Assessment 1 Guide, available on Blackboard, and will also be discussed in class.

AI Statement:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) provides emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI in completing this assessment task; however, students must clearly reference any use of AI in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment 2 - Case Study Report and Poster Presentation
assessments.due_date:
Component 1: Case Study Report (40%) 29/05/2026 3:00 pm

Component 2: Poster Presentation During Tutorial Class (20%) Week 13,
assessments.task_description:
Assessment 2 comprises two components: a Case Study Report (40%) and a Poster Presentation (20%). The Case Study Report requires students to prepare a business analytics report on a selected business, while the Poster Presentation component involves preparing and presenting a poster based on the content of the Case Study Report. Further details regarding assessment requirements, format, and style are provided in the Assessment 2 Guide, available on Blackboard, and will also be discussed in class.

Please Note: The assessment will be recorded for marking purposes per UQ Policy.

AI Statement:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) provides emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI in completing this assessment task; however, students must clearly reference any use of AI in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
A reflective assessment in which students record a brief video presenting their key learnings from the course and how these differ from their previous perspectives and experiences. Note that the reflective assessment is scheduled during the examination period. More details regarding the reflective assessment will be discussed later in the semester and provided on Blackboard as the Assessment 3 Guide.

AI Statement:

Students may appropriately use AI in completing this assessment task; however, students must clearly reference any use of AI in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

learning_activities.topic:
Course Introduction and the Business Analytics Field

This lecture introduces the BSAN2201 course and assessments, the Business Analytics major/field, and career pathways.

Note: There are no tutorials in Week 1. Tutorials will commence from Week 2.

Learning outcomes: L01
